skill.name: rn-state-flows
skill.description: Complex multi-step operations in React Native. Use when implementing flows with multiple async steps, state machine patterns, or debugging flow ordering issues.
skill.summary: Complex multi-step operations in React Native. Use when implementing flows with multiple async steps...
skill.author: CJHarmath

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown patterns and TypeScript examples. No executable code, no scripts, no network access, no file system access. Content teaches best practices for state machine implementation in React Native.

content.value_statement: Multi-step operations with dependencies are prone to ordering bugs and missing preconditions. This skill provides proven patterns for implementing state machines and flow tracking in React Native applications.
actual_capabilities: Provides state machine pattern documentation with preconditions, actions, and postconditions
Shows explicit flow implementation with validation and logging
Demonstrates Flow Object pattern for breaking down complex async operations
Covers flow state tracking for UI feedback in React Native components
Includes integration testing patterns for flow validation
Offers decision criteria for when to use XState vs custom implementations
limitations: Contains documentation only - no executable code execution
Does not include XState library integration code
Focused on React Native patterns - not general web frameworks

output_examples.input: Show me how to implement a user registration flow with multiple steps and validation
output: State Machine Pattern: Define states (idle, validating, submitting, complete, error)
Preconditions: Check form validity before each step
Action: Execute async API call for registration
Postcondition: Verify server response and user created
Error Handling: Catch and surface validation errors to UI

best_practices: Always document preconditions and postconditions for each flow step
Log state transitions with unique flow IDs for debugging
Test complete flows, not just individual functions
Surface flow state to UI for user feedback on progress and errors
anti_patterns: Missing await on async operations in flow sequences
Not validating postconditions after each step
Scattering flow logic across multiple unrelated functions
Skipping error handling at individual steps

faq.question: Is XState required to use these patterns?
faq.answer: No. These patterns work without any library. XState is recommended only for complex flows with 6+ states or parallel branches.

faq.question: Can these patterns be used outside React Native?
faq.answer: Yes. The patterns are general TypeScript/JavaScript patterns that work in any JavaScript environment.

faq.question: How do I handle nested flows?
faq.answer: Create separate flow functions and compose them. Each nested flow should have its own state tracking and error handling.

faq.question: Is this skill safe to use?
faq.answer: Yes. This is pure documentation with example code snippets. No executable code is run when using this skill.

faq.question: How do I debug flow issues?
faq.answer: Use unique flow IDs in all log statements. Log before and after each step with preconditions and postconditions checked.

faq.question: When should I prefer custom patterns over XState?
faq.answer: Use custom patterns for flows under 6 states with simple branching. XState provides visualization and formal verification for complex scenarios.
